title: Is the U.S. stock market closed on Friday for New Year's Eve? No. It isn't even closed on Monday. Here's why!
text:
We are in our late 50s and have retired with less than $1 million: ‘Did I jump the gun?'

Have a question about your own retirement savings? Email us at HelpMeRetire@marketwatch.com See full story.

My wife and I bought a foreclosed condo in 2009, and our son lives in it rent-free. Should we put the deed in his name?

‘We have paid both the homeowners association fees and property taxes amounting to $2,000 per year because he works minimum-wage jobs.' See full story.

These stocks are down at least 20% from 2021 highs, but Wall Street sees them gaining as much as 87% in 2022

More than 90 large-cap stocks are down at least 20% from their 2021 highs, but analysts love many of them, including JD.com, PayPal and Disney. See full story.

Social Security recipients are getting a big raise — but also are falling further behind

When you're getting 5.9% more in your Social Security payment, but the cost of living is up 6.8%, you've lost ground. See full story.
